title: Unexpectedly high GC constantly 10-20 seconds behind.
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2.48.1-stable-674b77f0`

OS & Version: Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS 

Drive type: NVME SSD SPCC M.2 PCIe SSD

Commit hash: 

Erigon Command (with flags/config): erigon --datadir="/data/erigon/datadir" --snap.stop --authrpc.jwtsecret="/data/erigon/jwtsecret" --batchSize=10MB --db.pagesize=64kb --pprof --torrent.download.slots=30 --torrent.download.rate=800mb --http --http.addr="0.0.0.0" --http.port="8545" --http.api="txpool,eth,admin,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon" --ws --internalcl --graphql

Concensus Layer: internalcl

Chain/Network: mainnet

#### Expected behaviour
After finishing the sync my GC was around 1% and slowly reducing but due to a power failure my server was down for 1-2 hours. After coming online the GC is at 3.1%. Is there any way to reduce this faster? At this rate it will take over 30 days to go down.

#### Actual behaviour

Mdbx’s GC % - it’s free pages amount. It’s not “time”. And it’s not much related to sync speed.
Sorry about that, my understanding of it came from other similar issues. So how would I resolve constantly being behind 10+ seconds?

This is all I see in the logs.
